author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Huskies Battle Quinnipiac in CT Ice Tournament Showdown
text:
Huskies Battle Quinnipiac in CT Ice Tournament Showdown
The UConn men's ice hockey team is set to compete in the CT Ice Tournament, vying for state bragging rights among four teams: #15 Quinnipiac, #13 UConn, Sacred Heart, and Yale. The Huskies are coming off a successful weekend, achieving a win and a tie against #5 Maine, bringing their overall record to 12-8-2 and 7-6-2 in Hockey East play. Rising star Joey Muldowney dominated the previous weekend, scoring four goals in a single match, while Hudson Schandor and John Spetz set new program records. UConn will face Quinnipiac in their tournament opener, aiming to overcome two consecutive championship losses to the Bobcats.
- UConn has scored 7 shorthanded goals, leading the nation.
- Joey Muldowney leads the team with 22 points; Hudson Schandor follows with 20.
- The Huskies are on a positive trajectory after a competitive weekend against a top-ranked team.
- They currently rank third in Hockey East scoring for multiple players, showcasing strong individual performances.
UConn aims to gain momentum in the CT Ice Tournament, looking to secure their first championship against a familiar rival, Quinnipiac. Continued strong performances from key players, particularly Muldowney and Schandor, will be crucial in upcoming games.
Bottom LineThe Huskies need to leverage their recent successes and exceptional talent to break their championship drought while reinforcing their position as a contender in both state and national arenas.
Read more at University of Connecticut Athletics
